![](http://elink.turing.ac.uk/o/4/eyJhaSI6NTkyMDc5NzIsImUiOiJ2aGVsbG9uQHR1cmluZy5hYy51ayIsInJpIjoiY29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1jYzA1Y2JmNzY4NWY0OGE2OTkyZDIyNWYyMjIxNDQ0MSIsInJxIjoicDEtYjI0MDE4LThiMjhlZWQ0ZTlhMjRkYjRiN2M4NDU4ZjRlYmNiZWY3IiwicGgiOm51bGx9/0hKKejXPpITfWJum1qej_A)

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/bannernewsletter.png)

This is January's Turing-Roche newsletter! We hope you had a restful break over the holiday season. Here you can find what's new in the Turing-Roche strategic partnership and opportunities, events and news from both the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and wider relevant networks.

Our [five year partnership](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FHZJqC_9m0jU61vCE8i_rDg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628477682%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=mB9%2BjwnpgTCCfujH9KzHOEPiU12lNNCMoCCM41rWpKE%3D&reserved=0) was officially launched in June 2021. Our 'North Star' is **to enable the generation of insights to better understand patient and disease heterogeneity and its relevance to clinical outcomes at an unprecedented level of precision in order to improve clinical care.**

We are developing multiple research activities over the five years to work towards our North Star, as well as building strong connections and collaborations between the Alan Turing Institute, Roche and the broader community.

If you have anything you'd like featured in a future newsletter then please get in touch with Vicky Hellon, Community Manager for the partnership at <vhellon@turing.ac.uk>

If you would like to share this newsletter with relevant colleagues please direct them to sign-up [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FSEup-CclYI9H5S48mtEiGw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628477682%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=REy6mG2Sdz9hMPA9haxsZicPfi1In96mfCaQrhA%2BS2E%3D&reserved=0).

## Turing-Roche Strategic Partnership Updates

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/photo-1457530378978-8bac673b8062.jfif)

### Tech-Talk Event: A principled approach to writing collaborative research code

**23 January 2024**

Run by our Turing-Roche Community Scholar, Ellen Visscher, the Tech-Talk series aims to facilitate the exchange of technical knowledge and skills between scientists in academia and industry.

The theme of this first event in the Tech-Talk series is writing collaborative research code. We will be hearing from final-year University of Oxford DPhil student, Claudia Vanea.

Claudia will explore the most useful techniques and practices for writing collaborative research code with examples from research codebases and personal experience. She will focus on version control, abstraction, project structure, and code review, with a special mention of testing and debugging.

More information on the event and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FMi9zDPkMbOqeVjRN-DXsAQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628477682%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=wJrv2KkMMjeXOh8QGmSwAozubChQz%2BMM5FJO6b7B9go%3D&reserved=0).

### Partnership to be a demonstrator at AI UK 2024

We're really excited to announce the partnership will have a [demonstration at AI UK](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fu98T7iYHNf2UNV3bWUbzEg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628477682%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=RiwPrCwaWeyGokjTArfGyr3q9A9pUhYmg7rLoGnQqrw%3D&reserved=0), the UK's national conference for data science and AI, organised by the Turing Institute. The partnership team will be at the demonstration and we'll have interactive elements of research from our collaboration for attendees to engage with and members of our [Community Scholar Scheme](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPS1jNWpwM1J1c1ljdzI5MDBKTE95ZzhxaGJKcXBlR2pQcG04Vm51MTVjVnhLV29sNGlqWURFYjlyaHU3X2J3bmgmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1jYzA1Y2JmNzY4NWY0OGE2OTkyZDIyNWYyMjIxNDQ0MSZlc2lkPTE2MDRhMTViLTk4YjQtZWUxMS1hNTY4LTYwNDViZGQxMzU5ZCJ9%2F5WuX7jzPmP3z_c4ltfamVA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628477682%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=0GAsCsJRRxnuXHIuegdr4GT6ze2FCM2OBs1%2BozpsMes%3D&reserved=0) showcasing their projects, Overall we hope to chat to the community about health data and what personalised healthcare really means and could look like.

Our Senior Research Associates Rohan Chakraborty and Chris Banerji will also be giving a talk at the conference on 'Different flavours of AI transparency for personalised healthcare'. You can register for AI UK [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPS1jNWpwM1J1c1ljdzI5MDBKTE95ZzhxaGJKcXBlR2pQcG04Vm51MTVjVnhLV29sNGlqWURFYjlyaHU3X2J3bmgmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1jYzA1Y2JmNzY4NWY0OGE2OTkyZDIyNWYyMjIxNDQ0MSZlc2lkPTE2MDRhMTViLTk4YjQtZWUxMS1hNTY4LTYwNDViZGQxMzU5ZCJ9%2FpXQTiLzj18i3UO4IbYrAXw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628477682%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=9KpC2cHCv87X982aabTVWwlzk3440c36g4X1tfF%2FfdU%3D&reserved=0)- we hope to see you there!

### Knowledge Share Series Event: Transparent AI for Healthcare

**30 January 2024**

Join us for our monthly [partnership knowledge share series](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FyeF-Zb57TA8S0lZiSxrjYQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628477682%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=RR4A5b1r0zkjrDAsjbZb1rq%2F4iIDxP0lhTr%2F%2BDC5CRU%3D&reserved=0). Our aim is to bring together members of the Turing and Roche networks and the wider scientific community to hear partnership research updates and share different academic and industry perspectives on areas related to patient/treatment heterogeneity and data science more generally.

January's event is on the 30th and we will be hearing from our partnership Senior Research Associate Rohan Chakraborty on the topic of transparent AI for healthcare. He will discuss the different flavours of transparent AI, from explainable models to interpretable results and why these are important for trustworthiness of AI models in healthcare and clinical applications. You can register for the event [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FPzQ5i3wRSiMHH0EpfKWoVQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628477682%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=3vbNZ9ixj7f6h8B7CXCoojS%2F5vwMdtXo%2FWgGcDybiuQ%3D&reserved=0). 

You can catch-up on previous recordings of our events at our [YouTube channel](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F4dKCuV0zOCcuUKc6uNYq0A&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628633914%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=jA6T5vIW81%2FyRshJmnDKWjGwHeqVDfCyS1ObWMYIxOs%3D&reserved=0).

### New publication on hypoxia in Muscular Dystrophy from our partnership Senior Research Associate Chris Banerji

Our partnership Senior Research Associate Chris Banerji has a new paper out from his independent research.

'[Hypoxia enhances human myoblast differentiation: involvement of HIF1α and impact of DUX4, the FSHD causal gene](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPS1jNWpwM1J1c1ljdzI5MDBKTE95ZzhxaGJKcXBlR2pQcG04Vm51MTVjVnhLV29sNGlqWURFYjlyaHU3X2J3bmgmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1jYzA1Y2JmNzY4NWY0OGE2OTkyZDIyNWYyMjIxNDQ0MSZlc2lkPTE2MDRhMTViLTk4YjQtZWUxMS1hNTY4LTYwNDViZGQxMzU5ZCJ9%2F8bIMNk1JTmc8TRUROwQQUA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628633914%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=UcwSy3P202DCEhHhdhw1UeesKTPxDPy%2B4ShE5EJQ5K4%3D&reserved=0)' was published in Skeletal Muscle with colleagues from the University of Mons and Kings College London. The paper examines the impact of hypoxia on human myoblasts. 

## Current News and Opportunities from The Alan Turing Institute and Roche

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/group_study_working__0.jpg)

### Turing Connections PhD Student Presentation and Networking Event- March 2024

**Registration deadline: 02 February 2024**

**Event: 08 March 2024**

As part of the 'Turing Connections' initiative, the Turing Institute is hosting a free event for PhD students across the UK. The event will feature student presentations, a networking session and complimentary lunch. Find out more and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FfdZBC6QM-SZZbIU5ARErkg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628633914%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=QhQ4LN9HRlSYqmctiXaeTqfcCrb8XTTvOJttU%2BMqULo%3D&reserved=0).

### Roche Opportunity: Medical Statistics Degree Apprentice

**Application deadline: 22 January 2024**

Applications are open for 3-year Medical Statistics Apprenticeships at Roche. Successful applicants will combine study for a Medical Statistics MSc with practical on-the-job training. This includes providing your statistical and analytical expertise in multi-disciplinary teams alongside experienced statisticians to drive the design, conduct and analysis of clinical trials. More info and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FAwlCElZG1mIzRnzHIcha-g&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628633914%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=tyx89mrQ6D0AzbhxKPXhTPl5tBUa493dJXLr7jby%2F4s%3D&reserved=0).

### Turing Internship Network Applications Open

**Application deadline: 20 February 2024**

Applications are now open to join a placement with the Turing Internship Network (TIN). Now recruiting for the eighth time since launching in 2020, TIN offers doctoral students currently enrolled in a PhD at a university in the UK or Ireland the opportunity to undertake exciting and unique 3-12 month placements at one of the Turing's partners, with an indicative start date of May 2024.

In this new recruitment round, there are 7 paid internship opportunities in areas of research spanning from digital twins for clinical trials, data science applied to the education sector, and large language models for justice reports. Opportunities are at Accenture, Ministry of Justice and the education start-up Everybody Counts. Find out more and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FdPGmnRNoTp-NW2O1Q7vNaQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628633914%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=zPdH%2Ft2KItudiZA6knQ2zPItbUdSsxevgkflh%2FGPUDo%3D&reserved=0).

 **Current Turing Institute [job vacancies](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FFFsdmLlvN8ACVIaI5l_3MQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628633914%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=yRbSVuck4bZKuAFi%2FYgTNKXgEDZiS3IgQeV7VgDLrw4%3D&reserved=0)**

## Events

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/ags-0057_800-px-wide.jpg)

### Turing Clinical AI Interest Group Seminar: AI for Women's Health

**24 January 2024**

Turing's [Clinical AI Interest Group](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FC2h667vsav34qMVOiqUMIw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628633914%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=VEujYlcETKrC0s0tzXCOqx2TjWm5L7z342GhslUswj8%3D&reserved=0) has formed supra-interest groups in different clinical specialties to bring together clinicians and AI experts in a more focused manner. The AI for Women's Health supra-interest group is hosting a virtual event in January with the below talks:

-   'Integrative analyses of multi-omics data in trials to predict treatment response' by Holley Tovey, Maggie Cheang and Xixuan Zhu [who is also one of our Turing-Roche Community Scholars!], from The Institute of Cancer Research
-   'Improving diagnosis of endometriosis -- molecular and imaging biomarkers' by Dr Monika Golinska, Senior Scientific Associate at the VISION lab at Cancer Research UK Cambridge Institute

More info and how to register [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FmDH40qJw1ZwyMhzznOAKDg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628790189%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=U9MjHgADHS9S4oWQGnIvrNihaTyThx6H%2FLOY%2FlkwFGs%3D&reserved=0).

### Turing Causal Inference Interest Group Seminar: 'Causal Diagrams in R with ggdag- New tools for better DAGs'

**05 February 2024**

Turing's [Causal Inference Interest Group](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fd9wCUqm4SVGWzjCE834AZw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628790189%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=FNrZtkPmty%2FOaEFr1iv0zGrrxrvw3BQDocpY0WFZitg%3D&reserved=0) are hosting a virtual seminar with speaker Malcolm Barrett from Stanford University. He will be talking about new features in his ggdag R package, such as automatic time-ordering, creating and pruning fully saturated Directed Acyclic Graphs (DAGs), easier customization, and better support for DAG-data consistency checks. Further info on the event and registration [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F_d4nGmwNLolp5-j4qByJTg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628790189%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=JJHPYAJUoCebZ3AEPNPm1bFNTmKa9sqNtK8OoN8URGI%3D&reserved=0).

## Other Opportunities

![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/alex-shutin-204369-unsplash.jpg)

### University of Bristol Senior Lecturer (Associate Professor)/Lecturer in Artificial Intelligence roles

**Application deadline: 21 January 2024**

The University of Bristol has two academic roles open in Artificial Intelligence. They are especially welcoming applicants with a strong track record in one of the following AI specialisms: Natural Language Processing and Large Language Models, Distributed and Collective Artificial Intelligence, Reinforcement Learning and Multi-agent Reinforcement Learning or alternatively, from candidates innovating with AI in domains such as Medicine and Healthcare, Robotics and/or Autonomous Systems, or Computational Neuroscience.

More info and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_%2FUWVucjKUWbdzHT6pIMkAAQ&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628790189%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=k64dmAiTRSVhXM257kh05s4WP2%2FoY%2BU2%2BQvdj6LoNPA%3D&reserved=0).

### Postdoctoral Health Data Scientist role at the University of Oxford

**Application deadline: 26 January 2024**

The University of Oxford have an open post for a Postdoctoral Health Data Scientist to join the research group led by Associate Professor Sara Khalid at the Planetary Health Informatics Group. The group combines fair and safe artificial intelligence, remote monitoring technology and clinical epidemiology to study international real-world health, environment, and climate data, for the prevention and treatment of human diseases and to fill the gaps in global health, leveraging common data models and federated network analytics. Find out more and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_%2F1iFEw46aeWaS1u6sq1nzOg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628790189%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=qGSO%2Ftt6cH62WN5a7YjJA8JT0d%2Fp7akoyIx1J4R6Kuc%3D&reserved=0).

### University of Birmingham 125th Anniversary Opportunities: Fellow and Chair roles

**Application deadline: 30 January 2024**

In 2025, the University of Birmingham will be celebrating 125 years of University status by Royal Charter. To celebrate, they will be appointing 100 new Anniversary Fellows and 25 new Anniversary Chairs. These roles are open to global talent with an outstanding record of research excellence, including researchers in the fields of AI and data science.

Recruitment will remain open until 2025, with the deadline for the first phase of applications being 30 January 2024. More details and application information [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FzER8luVyqDm-HNWroly2pw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628790189%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ZInvNbBQJi6sRJ7aOQQOX%2B43xVPHqaQa9WOcsIlK6cc%3D&reserved=0).

### Survey on clinical priorities for cancer risk prediction

**Survey deadline: 30 January 2024**

Calling all health and allied professionals using cancer risk prediction tools - the Cancer Data Driven Detection (CD3) initiative needs your views!

CD3 is a proposed new, national research initiative dedicated to using data to revolutionise our understanding of cancer risk and to allow early interception of cancers. Cancer Research UK are leading the project with support from Health Data Research UK (HDR UK), The Alan Turing Institute, the Economic and Social Research Council's Administrative Data Research UK programme (ADR UK), and the Engineering and Physical Sciences Research Council (EPSRC), with involvement of the National Institute for Health and Care Research (NIHR). The ambition is to bring expertise in cancer risk, epidemiology, multi-omics, early detection, prevention, health informatics and data science together. 

This [10 min survey](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fhtbybr3_tcDyfCe01FOF-Q&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628790189%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=%2FB43uZy5k4eQRg3C7FMDp6ZQeGFxzizFGFzDdoCxpxo%3D&reserved=0) aims to generate insights into how improvements in cancer risk prediction should be targeted to ensure most benefit to routine clinical practice.

### Call for Fellowship applications - HDR UK Big Data for Complex Disease Driver Programme

**Application deadline: 05 February 2024**

Health Data Research UK's (HDR UK) [Big Data for Complex Disease (BDCD) Driver Programme](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPS1jNWpwM1J1c1ljdzI5MDBKTE95ZzhxaGJKcXBlR2pQcG04Vm51MTVjVnhLV29sNGlqWURFYjlyaHU3X2J3bmgmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1jYzA1Y2JmNzY4NWY0OGE2OTkyZDIyNWYyMjIxNDQ0MSZlc2lkPTE2MDRhMTViLTk4YjQtZWUxMS1hNTY4LTYwNDViZGQxMzU5ZCJ9%2FwgX0R_rhtYbNmKcLvfOUmg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628946455%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=NYVys3LSwRctbYIK5fzjRZ%2BSAj3JmhS6%2B9KevZe%2BCqw%3D&reserved=0) is offering up to five generously funded Fellowships, each of up to four years at any of nine eligible universities.  

The programme is designed to accelerate the careers of high potential early career researchers who wish to pursue a career in health data science, and help deliver the ambitious aims of the BDCD Driver Programme to harness whole population, national linked health data to improve the prevention, diagnosis and treatment of cardiovascular disease, cancer, and other complex diseases. Each Fellowship will fund the salary and associated on costs of each Fellow, plus up to £15,000 per annum in research costs. More info and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2Fr3-8pRQ9qjweFyG9a7eFow&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628946455%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=t8c6DoRFhQd9nimAdr5a8qTkissLmjTVa0rj%2F6D4Kds%3D&reserved=0).

### PhD Studentships at the University of Sussex

**Application deadline: 19 February 2024**

University of Sussex have three fully-funded (internationals included) PhD studentships available within [Sussex AI](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FXpqM1HBivLgHe5xn6ouYGA&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628946455%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=SYmzSyUHCD77z4oLus4O%2BoNh4Y9Jr7RPi%2Frr%2FnPsBro%3D&reserved=0), starting in September 2024. This is a great opportunity for doctoral research in the interdisciplinary Centre of Excellence, which is the focal point for research in AI methods and applications.

Prospective students are encourgaed to submit innovative proposals that either:

-   Engage with theoretical challenges in Artificial Intelligence.
-   Develop new Artificial Intelligence methods that have potential to enable novel applications.
-   Address complex problems that require research at the intersections of traditional disciplinary boundaries.

Further information and how to apply [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FlGzuUTSJyj3OqDCC_LpMcg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628946455%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=VNsUKAmyaU3CMnnDqI2DEHhg2eHH0auX5MraycT6OPw%3D&reserved=0).

## Featured Community Scholar of the Month

In September 2023 we welcomed our first cohort of Turing-Roche Community Scholars: 10 UK PhD students who are joining the partnership for 12 months to develop community-based projects for the partnership, alongside their ongoing PhD studies. Each month we are featuring a different scholar in our newsletter.

You can find out more about our community scholars [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2FRApqh9WE3KGyCEjRIwJcNw&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628946455%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=X3CfFUifYVDGj8CKtqi6qqQWXbtO2yuocSm7WAsYvRk%3D&reserved=0). You can also see more about their plans for their projects [here](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%%2F75O9b9G1ypJcF2TT7hbdbg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628946455%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=VtF1Gcs5m4GVN0j%2Fac7mf9AvRgzVeDSb0jb9H8Ci0ec%3D&reserved=0).

This month's scholar is Xixuan Zhu, from the Institute of Cancer Research.
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/xixuanzhu1.jpg)

**Tell us a little bit about yourself and your current research:**

I am from China originally but moved to the UK for my undergraduate study. I was in Liverpool and was pursuing a BSc in Computer Science. Following my undergraduate degree, and my interest in biology, I then studied a master's in biomedical research with data science. After dipping my toes in interdisciplinary research, I decided to pursue a PhD in cancer research, at the Institute of Cancer Research in London. My PhD looks at molecular characterisation of ER+ HER2+ and triple negative breast cancer, using multi-omics data generated from tumour samples collected from clinical trials. Together with the long-term follow-up on patient survival, as well as recorded treatment responses, I aim to develop an AI system to predict treatment response and long-term survival based on the tumour characteristics.

**What is your planned community scholar project? Why is this of interest to you?**

I aim to produce a short documentary focusing on the journey of a tumour sample collected from clinical trial. The journey will include 3 main parts: (1) collecting and storing the sample; (2) multi-omics experiments; (3) translational study to understand the tumour characteristics. Overall, the message of this documentary is to introduce how the "circle of life" of a tumour sample is helping to improve personalised clinical care for cancer patients, and to strengthen the connection among patients, clinical trial scientists and translational researchers.

As a PhD student working on the translational research in the clinical trials unit, I get to witness how data generated from clinical trials could be used to bring new insights on cancer and to help improve personalised health care. Together with my interest in filming, I proposed this community project.

**What was your last impulse buy?**

I got 3 vintage records from Tooting market for £20. The albums are from Ella Fitzgerald, Dinah Washington, and Brenda Lee. Do I regret it? No. Will I buy more records soon? Yes.

## Publication of the Month
![](https://file-eu.clickdimensions.com/turingacuk-ap7zg/files/patrick-tomasso-oaqk7qqnh_c-unsplash2.jpg)

### Spatial proteomic characterization of HER2-positive breast tumors through neoadjuvant therapy predicts response

This month's publication of the month is [this paper](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Felink.turing.ac.uk%2Fc%2F7%_X2NsZGVlPS1jNWpwM1J1c1ljdzI5MDBKTE95ZzhxaGJKcXBlR2pQcG04Vm51MTVjVnhLV29sNGlqWURFYjlyaHU3X2J3bmgmcmVjaXBpZW50aWQ9Y29udGFjdC00ODgwYThjMzkyM2NlYzExOGM2MjAwMjI0ODQzNGZlYi1jYzA1Y2JmNzY4NWY0OGE2OTkyZDIyNWYyMjIxNDQ0MSZlc2lkPTE2MDRhMTViLTk4YjQtZWUxMS1hNTY4LTYwNDViZGQxMzU5ZCJ9%2FavuntjVuIpOI-bqPJAyQwg&data=05%7C02%7Cvhellon%40turing.ac.uk%7C55593342938f4e4ffa3e08dc1817fd0d%7C4395f4a7e4554f958a9f1fbaef6384f9%7C0%7C0%7C638411738628946455%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=lc2BPkAFJdqHzh%2BfKFhQNO3K0yUcWrLkC2sTdq%2BF%2FYc%3D&reserved=0), chosen by our featured Community Scholar Xixuan Zhu. 

'This is a research paper looking at the associations of spatial proteomic characteristics of HER2-positive breast cancer with neoadjuvant therapy response. By using the NanoString GeoMx Digital Spatial Profiling technology, this group characterised the spatial proteomics (40 tumour and immune markers) of core biopsies collected at pre-treatment and on-treatment (14-21 days of HER2-targeted therapy) from 28 patients. The result suggested that the proteomic changes after a single cycle of HER2-targeted therapy aids the identification of tumours that eventually undergo pathological complete response (pCR).

I found this paper really useful because I am also working on breast cancer characterisation using spatial transcriptomics and proteomics data, and this paper helps generate some ideas of what type of analysis that we could do to understand the spatial data better.'
